messages.message:
@Heymian can you confirm we don’t use any typeshed (https://github.com/python/typeshed/tree/main) stubs in our monorepo? My understand is that our mypy version is too old to properly support typeshed stubs that are in newer version.

Asking this because I do see `types-stripe` is used to type check `stripe` package in `shared-utils/py-utils/billing-utils/src/py/instabase/billing_utils` . Don’t we need to create a new stub for stripe instead of using types-stripe? cc: @Victor Zeng
Type checking seems to be working on Jenkins and locally with `types-stripe`. Do we do type checking anywhere else?

i’m not certain, i vaguely remember that we borrowed from typeshed before and modified them as needed for our repo, but not too many libraries were done this way. 

@Victor Zeng we always do mypy checks with “make build mypy” so if you’re relying on a different directive, it might not actually be running the type checks. you can easily check by typing something wrong and verifying “make mypy” fails. If so, then things should be all good.
